E. Brunskill
A. Anandkumar
dcterms:description: A collection of various Atari 2600 games used for evaluating reinforcement learning algorithms, particularly in stochastic environments with large action spaces.
dcterms:title: Atari 2600 games

dcterms:creator: G. Brockman
V. Cheung
L. Pettersson
J. Schneider
J. Schulman
J. Tang
W. Zaremba
dcterms:description: A toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms, providing a variety of environments including classic control tasks and Atari games.
dcterms:title: OpenAI gym

dcterms:creator: V. Mnih
K. Kavukcuoglu
D. Silver
A. Graves
I. Antonoglou
D. Wierstra
M. Riedmiller
dcterms:description: A set of specific Atari games including Enduro, Boxing, Pong, Asterix, Kung-Fu Master, and Breakout, used to demonstrate the effectiveness of deep reinforcement learning techniques.
dcterms:title: Atari games

dcterms:creator: R. Dearden
N. Friedman
S. Russell
dcterms:description: Domains consisting of loop and maze structures used to evaluate Bayesian Q-learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: Loop and Maze domains
